newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian base metals steady in dull trade.
newsitem.headline: Indian base metals steady in dull trade.

text.p: Base metals held steady in dull narrow trade on Wednesday, dealers said.
"Demand from industrial consumers was low but scattered supplies kept prices in a narrow band," said a dealer.
"Supplies were poor due to restricted sales by state-owned agencies and reduced imports," said a dealer.

Ready copper was unchanged at 12,800 rupees per quintal and zinc at 6,300 rupees. Lead was quiet at 4,850 rupees. Tin was available at 36,000 rupees and nickel at 37,300 rupees per quintal. Aluminium held steady at 7,450 rupees per quintal.
